title: Blessings of the Righteous
shortSummary: Psalm 112 celebrates the blessings and stability bestowed upon the man who fears the LORD and delights in His commandments. It contrasts the enduring righteousness and generosity of the upright with the ultimate downfall of the wicked, encouraging believers to trust steadfastly in God.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, attributed to the time of King David

keyCharacters.name: The Righteous Man
keyCharacters.description: The central figure of the psalm who fears the LORD, delights in His commandments, and exemplifies godly character and generosity.

keyCharacters.name: The Wicked
keyCharacters.description: Those who oppose God’s ways and ultimately face grief and destruction as a result of their rebellion.

definitions.definition: A reverential awe and deep respect for God that leads to obedience and trust.
A biblical symbol of strength, power, and honor.
Descendants or offspring; often used to indicate the continuation of a godly lineage.
The enduring legacy and honor that the righteous receive from God and people.

outline.heading: Blessings of the Godly Man
outline.description: The psalm opens by praising the LORD and declaring the blessings upon the man who fears God and delights in His commandments, including prosperity, righteous offspring, and enduring righteousness.

outline.heading: Character and Conduct of the Upright
outline.description: This section describes the godly man’s character as gracious, compassionate, and prudent, highlighting his generosity and wise management of affairs.

outline.heading: Stability and Confidence in God
outline.description: The righteous are assured of their stability and lack of fear, trusting fully in the LORD even in the face of evil tidings and enemies.

outline.heading: Generosity and Honor
outline.description: The godly man’s generosity toward the poor is emphasized, along with the enduring nature of his righteousness and the exaltation of his honor.

outline.heading: The Fate of the Wicked
outline.description: The psalm concludes by contrasting the righteous with the wicked, who will be grieved and perish, highlighting the ultimate victory of righteousness.

application: Cultivate a deep reverence and fear of the LORD by meditating on His commandments and delighting in obedience.
Practice generosity and compassion toward others, especially the poor, as a reflection of godly character.
Trust steadfastly in God during times of uncertainty and opposition, knowing He establishes the hearts of the righteous.
Manage your affairs with wisdom and discretion, seeking to honor God in all aspects of life.

keyVerses.text: Praise ye the LORD. Blessed is the man that feareth the LORD, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the foundation for the entire psalm, emphasizing the blessedness of fearing God and delighting in His law.

keyVerses.text: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the unwavering trust and courage of the righteous in the face of adversity.

keyVerses.text: He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his righteousness endureth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the lasting honor and blessing that come from generosity and enduring righteousness.

keyVerses.text: The wicked shall see it, and be grieved; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.
keyVerses.significance: It provides a sobering contrast showing the ultimate defeat and despair of the wicked.
